description.p: A perfectly balanced dagger with a shining blue gem in the hilt. After spending an hour with this weapon, a magical ilnk is made between you and the weapon.
Use a bonus action to teleport this dagger to your hand.
Proficiency with a dagger allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

It is the main weapon of The Shadow, which during the time when George and the demon were disconnected, but united, was stuck in the mind of George. Now, that they have united as one, after the death of Enzo and everything that has happened to him, he can act with it as he pleases, taking it from the nonexistent plane, to occupy it in the existing one.
Proficiency with a greatsword allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Add an additional +2 to all attack and damage rolls. If living, the target takes an additional 1d6 necrotic damage. Undead, Contructs, Objects, etc are immune to this effect. Upon slaying a living target, the user regains 10hp.
Within a 60ft cone, choose four creatures and make range attacks against them. On a hit, each target suffers piercing damage equal to: 1d6 + your profciency bonus + your Dexterity modifier.

You gain +1 to attack and damage rolls. You have advantage to disarm your opponent. Curse: Tempermental - If you roll a 1 or 2 on an attack roll, the flat of the sword smacks the wielder in the face, dealing 1d4 bludgeoning damage and breaking a tooth.

These daggers are made of a pitch black material that feels much like chipped glass. The daggers deal 1d4 slashing damage plus an additional 1d4 necrotic damage. These daggers pass through cloth and skin leaving no visible wound. "All damage is internal."
1d10 piercing damage. +1 to attack and damage rolls. While aiming you gain:

ul.li: Predator's Sight - Darkvision equal to heavy crossbow normal range.
Prehistoric Sight - The Ability to see in magical darkness equal to your normal darkvision.

description.p: When you reduce a creature to 0 hitpoints with needle, you gain up to half of its maxhitpoints as charges up to a maximum of 30. As an action, you can twist off the blade and inject the Needle's fluid into a willing creature, healing 1 hitpoint for each charge you have.
You gain +1 to attack and damage rolls when you are wielding both magical blades as a pair, additionally it only requires one attunement slot to attune to both of these blades.

ul.li: Poisoned Blades: A creature struck by these blades must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute.
Scorpion's Sting: When a creature misses an attack of opportunity on you, you may use your reaction to make one melee attack using the blades of the scorpion.

description.p: You gain +1 to attack and damage rolls. You damage is 1d8 piercing damage + 1d4 poison damage. (2/short rest) Ensnaring Ivy: When landing a successful hit, you may choose to cause the blade to instantly sprout a tangle of ivy vines. The target must succeed a Strength save DC 16 or become Restrained for 3 rounds. They may attempt another save at the start of their turn. On scoring a critical hit, the Ensnaring Ivy effect is triggered for free.

This pitch dark piece of ammunition is composed of densely packed shadows. A creature hit by this magic ammuntion takes psychic damage instead of piercing damage. This ammunition make no sound when it's fired or strikes a surface. It leaves no discernible wounds and vanishes immediately after hitting a creature.
